stepTitle: At $$500$$ K, the equilibrium constant is: $$K=3.62$$ × 10⁻⁶. If a $$4.30$$ M solution of HCN is prepared and allowed to reach equilibrium at $$500$$ K, what is the equilibrium concentration of H+ in moles? Calculate your answer to the fifth decimal place.
stepBody: Hint: Use ICE Table to solve and show your work and can neglect $$x$$ in denominator
